definition: two (colloquial equivalent of 兩個|两个)/both/some

sentences.chinese: 這是一種令人沮喪的熟悉伎倆。

sentences.english: The wrist rests on top of the gel pad providing comfort and support.
sentences.chinese: 頂部的膠墊提供應伎倆舒服的支持。

sentences.english: Democrats dismissed the moves as political gimmickry.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人將此舉斥爲政治伎倆。

sentences.english: Emma saw its artifice, and returned to her first surmises.
sentences.chinese: 愛瑪看穿了她的伎倆，又回到了原先的猜疑上。

sentences.english: He thought this strategy might help to contain her outrage.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲這一伎倆很可能使她剋制住憤怒。

sentences.english: There are minds facing states, so how Bo grows up one day ?
sentences.chinese: 臥輪有伎倆，能斷百思想對境心不起，菩提日日長。

sentences.english: They resorted to the trick of passing off fish-eyes as pearls.
sentences.chinese: 他們使用了魚目混珠的伎倆。

sentences.english: He was overwrought and may have mistaken witchcraft for healing.
sentences.chinese: 他勞累過度，也許把女巫的伎倆誤認爲治療術了。

sentences.english: The unexpectedness of Satan's methods are often as big as trap as the methods themselves.
sentences.chinese: 而且，撒但的伎倆往往是我們意想不到的。

sentences.english: And that an old dog can learn a new trick.
sentences.chinese: 廉頗老矣，也可學到新的伎倆。
其他的伎倆也是一個接着一個。

sentences.english: You may vehemently deny that you’ve ever fallen victim to such ploys.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會強烈地否認你曾經成爲這些伎倆的受害者。

sentences.english: The booty bump hula hoop trick involves bending over and getting the hoop to spin vertically.
sentences.chinese: 呼啦圈的戰利品凸點伎倆涉及彎腰和得到垂直旋轉箍。

sentences.english: I am profoundly ignorant of all these stock-jobbing intrigues.
sentences.chinese: 請原諒，我對這種種證券賭博的伎倆實在太無知了。

sentences.english: Officials said he could have made thousands of dollars (euros) by pulling the same stunt.
sentences.chinese: 當局官員說，他因施此伎倆而搜刮了幾千元錢。

sentences.english: This is his versed trick, what's called "selling the drummy".
sentences.chinese: 這是他所精通的“聲東擊西”的伎倆。

definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
